question: The ________ command is used to display the list of running processes in Linux.
The ps command displays information like Process ID (PID), terminal, and ________ usage.
The ________ command makes a script pause until a process finishes executing.
The ________ command delays execution for a given time (in seconds, minutes, or hours).
The ________ command is used to terminate a script or process in Linux.
To forcefully terminate a process, you can use the ________ option with the kill command.
The ________ command is useful when you need to wait for a process to finish before starting another task.
The ________ command shows all running processes, including their CPU and memory usage.
The ________ command can be used to find the process ID (PID) of a program.
To end a process in Linux, you use the ________ command.
The ________ command is often used to pause execution for a specified time during a script.
The exit command returns a ________ code, which helps in error handling.
The ________ command is used to pause execution for 3 seconds in a script.
The ________ command can be used to terminate all instances of a program.
The ________ command shows the process ID (PID), terminal, and CPU usage of running processes.
The ________ command ends a process or script without any error handling.
The ________ command can be used to kill a process by its PID in Linux.
You can use the ________ command to terminate a process forcefully by its PID.
The ________ command will wait for the specified process ID to complete before continuing.
The ________ command is used to check if a process is running in the background.
The ________ command is useful when you want to pause execution between iterations in a loop.
The ________ command can be used to check if a specific file exists before terminating a process.
The ________ command is used to check running processes with detailed information such as memory usage.
The ________ command is helpful to stop an unresponsive process by using its PID.
The ________ command is useful when you want to delay the execution of the script for 5 seconds.
The ________ command can be used to pause execution between each iteration of a loop.
The ________ command displays all the processes running under the root user.
The ________ command is often used to pause the execution of a script during debugging.
The ________ command can be used to stop a process by its name instead of the PID.
The ________ command can be used in scripts to ensure that a background process completes before proceeding.
The ________ command provides the status of a process, such as CPU time and memory usage.
The ________ command can be used to run a process in the background while continuing other tasks.
The ________ command helps to stop a program or process that is taking too long to respond.
The ________ command is used to terminate a running process by its PID in Linux.
The ________ command is often used to add a pause in the execution of a script during automation.
The ________ command helps to ensure that background tasks are completed before the next step is executed.
The ________ command is used to monitor and manage processes in Linux.
The ________ command is used to run a process in the background while the terminal remains free for other commands.
The ________ command pauses a script for 2 seconds during execution.
The ________ command can be used to send a kill signal to a process by its name.
The ________ command helps to check the status of processes running on your system.
The ________ command is often used when you want to wait for a process to finish before doing something else.
The ________ command can be used to check the current processes running on your system.
The ________ command helps to stop a process or program that has become unresponsive.
The ________ command returns a success status code when a script ends normally.
The ________ command pauses for 5 seconds before executing the next line of code in a script.
The ________ command can be used to end a process by its name without specifying the PID.
The ________ command is used to forcefully stop a process that is not responding to a normal kill signal.
The ________ command pauses for 3 seconds before printing 'Done!' in a script.
The ________ command is useful when you want to delay the script execution for debugging purposes.
